intro: Vicia bivonae, commonly known as the Bivona vetch, is a flowering plant native to the Mediterranean region. It is a member of the Fabaceae family, characterized by its pod-bearing fruits and nitrogen-fixing ability. The plant typically grows to a height of about 30–60 cm, with trifoliate leaves and small, yellowish-white flowers. Its seeds are enclosed in slender, cylindrical pods and are often used as forage for livestock. Vicia bivonae is also valued in traditional medicine for its potential health benefits.
